result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip John Sands was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall maintain full time employment. If not employed, seek work with at least three applications per week. Report efforts to DOC agent.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for controlled substances on request of DOC, law enforcement, or designee.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip John Sands

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
& status conference:  Defendant Phillip John Sands in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Phillip John Sands.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion heard. 
David Gushulak sworn and testifies for State. 
Exhibit #1 Digital Recording-marked, offered & received
Exhibit #2 DOC Warrant Document-marked, offered & received
Cross. 
Donald Kolman sworn and testifies for Defense.
Court heard and denies motion to suppress. Defendant wishes to proceed with plea and sentencing today. Attorney Ocwieja and defendant leave courtroom to review plea questionnaire and return. Per agreement, defendant will plead to charge. State will remain silent as to sentence. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Defendant admits repeater allegation. State heard on prior convictions. Attorney Ocwieja recommends probation. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders one year probation with conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances except as prescribed. Defendant shall submit to random observed testing on request of DOC, law enforcement or designee. Defendant shall work full time or submit 3 applications per week, if not employed. Report efforts to agent. DNA ordered. Costs waived. No credit.

Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Phillip John Sands in court, late.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Phillip John Sands. Attorney Ocwieja heard on status of the case. At this time defendant is not going to accept the plea offer. Attorney Ocwieja requests another status so he can review the discovery. Attorney Pozorksi heard on not needing anyone from the crime lab to testify. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Phillip John Sands in court.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by phone for Phillip John Sands. Defendant stands mute and pleads not guilty to charge. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Per call from Sauk County Jail, defendant will not sign bond until released.

Defendant Phillip John Sands appeared by phone, in custody, from Sauk County Jail. Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD. Defendant will be in custody until 5-5-2022. State requests signature bond. Court orders $500 signature bond. Arraignment date set.
Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
